title: NBA reveals 2017 All-Star Game starters
text:
Jan 19, 2017 at 7:07p ET 0Shares 
Russell Westbrook has won the All-Star game MVP award in each of the last two seasons, and he's averaging a triple-double so far this year. But he won't be in the starting lineup for the West on Feb. 19 in New Orleans. 
The voting was done by a combination of fans, media members and players, and they collectively decided that Stephen Curry and James Harden were both more deserving than Westbrook was of starting in the West this season. 
Over in the East, Isaiah Thomas was the big name left off the list, as Kyrie Irving and DeMar DeRozan were the ones voted in as the starting guards. 
Check out the complete starting lineups below. Getty Images Getty Images WEST -- Guard: Stephen Curry, Golden State Warriors Guard: James Harden, Houston Rockets 
AP Frontcourt: Kevin Durant, Golden State Warriors 
Ronald Martinez Ronald Martinez Frontcourt: Kawhi Leonard, San Antonio Spurs Frontcourt: Anthony Davis, New Orleans Pelicans EAST -- Guard: Kyrie Irving, Cleveland Cavaliers Guard: DeMar DeRozan, Toronto Raptors 
AP Frontcourt: LeBron James, Cleveland Cavaliers Frontcourt: Giannis Antetokounmpo, Milwaukee Bucks 
Troy Taormina Troy Taormina-USA TODAY Sports Frontcourt: Jimmy Butler, Chicago Bulls 
Caylor Arnold Caylor Arnold-USA TODAY Sports
